snippet.title: Falcons secure finals berth in state league
snippet.content: RUGBY LEAGUE: The Falcons have secured a berth in the finals following a dominant victory, but there's still plenty of room for improvement according to coach Craig Ingebrigtsen. The Sunshine Coast took on the Central Queensland Capras at Browne Park for the Intrust Super Cup clash on Saturday night and ran home victorious 44-26. Ingebrigtsen said he was pleased with the result, but was frustrated his side started the game in a deficit. "I'm getting a bit sick of it to be honest," he said. "We were down 12-nil and they (Capras) had all the running and then we scored 26 points in about 15 minutes. "That's really frustrating from a coaching perspective and it's something we want to solve before we get to the finals." Ingebrigtsen said the Falcons were guaranteed a spot in the finals following the win but second place on the 14-team ladder was still up for grabs. "It might make the players comfortable, but it doesn't make me comfortable as a coach," he said. "But, I'm really happy that we're in the finals for the second year in a row and what we do with that opportunity that's been presented is how we will be remembered. "We've just got to make sure that we take it on and we embrace it." Despite starting slow, the Falcons entered half-time in front 26-12. The side followed through with a further four tries in the second half to finish strong. Ingebrigtsen said Lachlan Timm played well on his return, with Tui Kamikamica and Harrison Muller also putting in solid performances. Alex Bishop's performance at hooker was a highlight for the coach. "It was Bishop's best game of the year at nine," he said. "He was really good and he played 80 minutes at nine and was just durable and got the job done." The Falcons will hit the road for a third away game in a row this Saturday against the Mackay Cutters. "It's a real big game next week and they're a really good footy team and we're looking forward to that contest," Ingebrigtsen said. "They've had a bye this week so they'll be nice and fresh."
